idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States States is a polygon theme representing the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico of the United States.
descript.purpose: United States States provides boundaries and demographic information for the U.S. states. The boundaries are consistent with the block group, tract, and county data sets and are effective at regional and state levels.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.

citeinfo.title: United States States, 2012
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the states within the United States. States and Equivalent Entities are the primary governmental divisions of the United States. In addition to the 50 states, the Census Bureau treats the District of Columbia and Puerto Rico as the statistical equivalents of states for the purpose of data presentation.

attr.attrdef: The subregion of the United States in which a state is located. The U.S. subregions are as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau, except in this data set New England is classified as a subregion instead of a region.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF 1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF 1) data is based on the 2010 Census of Population and Housing.

citeinfo.title: 2007 Census of Agriculture
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

citeinfo.othercit: The farm attributes come from data published by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) based on the 2007 Census of Agriculture.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the state data set from TomTom MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2011.12. Clipped to the coastline with the Data & Maps 10 U.S. States data set. Removed the U.S. Virgin Islands. Added dataset related FIPS fields and calculated their values from the MultiNet field CODE. Attached and formatted the fields from 2010 Census Summary File 1 and Esri Data. Renamed and reordered fields to best match the Data & Maps 10 field names. Added field SQMI and calculated its values projected to Albers Equal Area. Recalculated POP00_SQMI and POP10_SQMI with new SQMI values. Put "-99" values into all number type fields (except SQMI) for records where there were no matches. Attached and formatted the 2007 Census of Agriculture fields from Data & Maps 10 U.S. States data set. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: TomTom MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
